result.markdown: --- title: "Tutorial" --- ## About this tutorial In this tutorial you will learn to modify an OBT linelist to add variables and analyses. ### ðŸŽ¯ Objectives - Understand the OBT linelist building workflow - Know how to add variables to an OBT linelist by using the dictionary - Know how to add analyses (tables and graphs) to an OBT linelist - Generate a linelist from a dictionary. ### ðŸ§­ Context MSF has been working in eastern and southern Chad since 2006 where our teams provide medical care and assistance to displaced people and local communities who often struggle with a lack of food. A measles OBT linelist was deployed, and need to be tweaked to better serve the needs of the field. ### Activities In this tutorial, you will get access to several files that we are going to use: - a (simplified) dictionary for a measles OBT linelist - an empty linelist generated by that dictionary - the most recent designer file We will use this files to discover how to generate linelists from a **setup file**, and modify this **setup file** to generate an improved linelist. Explanations will be given in simple text, or boxes (tips, notes etc.) and instructions will be given in instructions boxes: ::: {.callout-warning} I contain important information! ::: ::: {.callout-tip} I am a handy bit of information that may be omitted if you are in a hurry, but totally deserve some attention at some point. ::: ::: {.instructions} Now do **do something**! ::: ## Get ready ### Download and unzip the tutorial materials The files that you are going to use are stored on Github, bundled in a `zip` archive. ::: {.instructions} 1. Click on the button to download the archive. Save it on your computer (in your *Downloads* folder for example). ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: 2. Unzip the whole archive and save the files locally. It is better to save the unzipped folder in a location that is not actively synchronised with OneDrive at the moment. ::: ### Description of the folder content - a (simplified) **setup file** for a measles OBT linelist - an empty linelist generated by that dictionary to better help you see how the specs translate into the final product) - the most recent **designer file** ## Part 0: unlock files and functionalities {#sec-unblock-file} OBT linelists use VBA macros to add functionalities. As a consequence, linelists that come from the internet often need to be unblocked, and macro enabled in them. ::: {.instructions} Unblock your files, or make sure they are already unlocked. If you have never done that before, [follow the steps from this page](../how_to/unblock_files.qmd) ::: ## Part 1: Generate a linelist from an existing setup ## Part 2: Add columns to a linelist ### Continuous ### Categorical ## Part 3: Add analyses ## Part 4: Add an MoH export
